section.name: Configuring JSpider
section.p: JSpider is higly flexible and adaptable, which requires a lot of configuration. This section is a reference for every piece of configuration that can be done with JSpider.

subsection.name: Environment Configuration
subsection.p: This type of configuration is used to tell enable JSpider to exist in it's environment.

tr.td: Explains the necessary installation of an XML parser for users of JDK1.3 (From java 1.4, this is already provided by the platform).
Explains the usage of the JSPIDER_HOME environment variable to tell JSpider where it can find it files.

subsection.name: Common Configuration
subsection.p: This type of configuration is common to all configuration sets.

tr.td: Explains how the JSpider logging system works and can be configured.

subsection.name: Global Configuration
subsection.p: This type of configuration is global to a certain configuration set, and shared by all sites/plugins/etc...

tr.td: How to configure JSpider to use a proxy server to reach some destination hosts.
Determine the allocation of threads on certain types of task and monitoring of the load put on these thread pool

subsection.name: Per-site Configuration
subsection.p: This type of configuration is done on a per-site basis. Under the /conf/sites subdirectory you'll find different properties files for different sites.
The conf/sites.properties file contains the reference towards these configurations.

tr.td: Reference for the configuration of sites.properties, the configuration file that assigns a specific per-site configuration to a website.
Explains how to create a specific configuration for a certain site.
